info.title: Cybedefend API
info.description: CybeDefend is an advanced API for application security analysis. Based on a microservices architecture using TypeScript and the NestJS framework, it communicates via Kafka to ensure cooperation between services. Key features include OAuth 2.0 authentication, user/organization/project management, and REBAC-based permissions. It excels in static, dynamic, and IaC security analyses (SAST, DAST, IaC, etc.) by integrating various open source tools.

teamAssignments.description: Array of team assignments with roles for automatic addition upon invitation acceptance

service.description: Name of the service where the error occurred

method.description: Method name where the error occurred

solvedIssuesInLast7Days.description: Number of solved issues in the last 7 days

newIssuesInLast7Days.description: Number of new issues in the last 7 days

projects.description: List of projects with all informations

agentCategoriesSast.description: Active SAST agent vulnerability categories (internal names)

agentCategoriesIac.description: Active IAC agent vulnerability categories (internal names)

agentCategoriesSast.description: Active SAST agent vulnerability categories (full replacement list of internal names)

agentCategoriesIac.description: Active IAC agent vulnerability categories (full replacement list of internal names)

success.description: Indicates if the update was successful

message.description: Message describing the result of the update
Message describing the result of project deletion

prUrl.description: Pull / Merge Request URL if success

vulnerabilityId.description: Optional vulnerability identifier (UUID). If provided, the conversation will start focused on this vulnerability context.

initialMessage.description: Optional initial user message to send
initialMessage.example: List the critical vulnerabilities related to authentication.

message.description: Message describing the result of deletion

role.description: Role to assign to the member

success.description: Indicates if the removal was successful

role.description: Role to assign to the member

success.description: Indicates if role update was successful

language.description: Array of detected or target languages

private.description: Define if the scan is private

initializerUserId.description: User ID who initialized the scan

updatedAt.description: Last update date of the scan

startTime.description: Date and time when the scan started

endTime.description: Date and time when the scan ended

containers.description: Array of containers used or involved in this scan

progress.description: Progress of the scan in percentage (0-100)

message.description: Message describing the scan start result

detectedLanguages.description: Detected languages (if any) during scan initialization

vulnerabilityTypes.description: Types of vulnerabilities to look for.

vulnerableStartLine.description: Line number where the vulnerability starts

vulnerableEndLine.description: Line number where the vulnerability ends

code.description: Lines of code in the snippet

line.description: Line number where the element is found

code.description: Lines of code surrounding the dataflow item

isLastRequest.description: Indicates if this is the last request for this scan

vulnerabilityType.description: Type of the vulnerability (e.g., sast, sca, etc.)

file.description: File where the library is declared

isLastRequest.description: Indicates if this is the last SCA request

id.description: Unique identifier of the detected package

fileName.description: File name where the package was detected

createdAt.description: Date when the record was created

updatedAt.description: Date when the record was updated

createAt.description: Date when the scan was created

vulnerabilities.description: List of vulnerabilities matching the filters

vulnCountByType.description: Count of vulnerabilities grouped by type (SAST, SCA, IaC)

Number of vulnerabilities for the given state
